com.fuse.ui

Class TouchEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fuse.ui.TouchEvent

  • public class TouchEvent
extends Object
    TouchEvent class represents a single touch event (like touch-down, touch-up, touch-click, touch-double-click, touch-enter, etc.)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  TouchEvent.EventType
      Types of touches that can be represented by the TouchEvent class

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      TouchEvent.EventType eventType
      Type of touch event (up/down/click/etc.)
      Node mostRecentNode
      Latest node that was touched
      Node node
      First node that was touched (and which this touch is basically "assigned to")
      processing.core.PVector position
      Current position of this touch
      processing.core.PVector startPosition
      First position of this touch
      int touchId
      Id of this touch (for distinguishing between simltanous touches on multi-touch interfaces)

      Constructor and Description
      TouchEvent() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      TouchEvent copy()
      Creates a shallow copy of this instance, mainly used for creating follow-up event, like a touch-move after a touch-down, or a touch-click after a touch-up

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        String A string-based representation of this TouchEvent instance (mainly for debugging)

      • copy

        public TouchEvent copy()
        Creates a shallow copy of this instance, mainly used for creating follow-up event, like a touch-move after a touch-down, or a touch-click after a touch-up
        Returns:
        TouchEvent The created copy of this event

      • distance

        public float distance()
        Returns:
        float The distance between the original position (the position at which the touch started) and the current position

      • offset

        public processing.core.PVector offset()
        Returns:
        PVector The vector form the original position (the position at which the touch started) and the current position
